intro: Lepeostegeres lancifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it adapts well to dry conditions. The flowers bloom in spring and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
